text: Cornelis Philip van Lidth de Jeude (11 April 1744 â€“ 27 February 1830) was a Dutch politician. Van Lidt de Jeude was a descendant of a prominent regent family from Tiel. He alternated between alderman and mayor of Tiel during the Dutch Republic. He disappeared from the board in 1795. In 1806 he returned and became again a member of the city council. He served as a member of the States General of the Netherlands for Gelderland from 1814 to 1815 and as a member of the House of Representatives from 1815 to 1822. Van Lidt de Jeude died on 27 February 1830 at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1744 births Category:1830 deaths Category:Dutch politicians Category:Dutch mayors Category:Aldermen of the Netherlands Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands
title: Cornelis Philip van Lidth de Jeude
